articles.title: Israel's Strike on Hamas Leaders in Qatar Strains US Relations and Ceasefire Talks
articles.description: Israel conducted an airstrike in Doha, Qatar, targeting senior Hamas leaders involved in ceasefire negotiations. The attack drew criticism from the US and Qatar, with the latter calling it a "criminal assault" and stating it jeopardized peace talks. [1, 2, 4, 5, 10, 11, 12, 14]

articles.title: Nepal Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli Resigns Amid Violent Anti-Corruption Protests
articles.description: Nepal's Prime Minister K.P. Sharma Oli resigned on September 9, 2025, following widespread and violent anti-corruption protests led by Gen Z across the country, which included setting government buildings on fire and clashes with police. [3, 4, 5, 8, 13]

articles.title: US Economy Reports Significant Downward Revision of Job Growth, Signaling Weakening Market
articles.description: The US Bureau of Labor Statistics announced a substantial downward revision, indicating 911,000 fewer jobs were created from April 2024 to March 2025 than previously reported, raising concerns about the state of the job market. [1, 2, 10, 11]
